title: What is the Practice of Alchemy?
first_phrase: This is the last part of a text about alchemy and magic, centered on the practice of alchemy. In this section, the author includes quotes from Marsilio Ficino and discusses the primary material for metals, as well as the use of common metals in the preparation of medicines by sages. The text continues with a discussion of Tritemio, a German Benedictine monk known for his work in magic and alchemy, and his letters on magic. It then shifts to the practical side of alchemy, discussing alchemical praxis and the laboratory in which it is performed. The text concludes with a discussion of alchemical furnaces, tools, and instruments.

last_phrase: In conclusion, practicing alchemy involves manifesting the hidden forms of things through practical application and experimentation. It is important to focus on positive experiences and use nature's tools, like fire, to perform operations such as solutio and congela-tic. Remember, the laboratory is within ourselves, and we must consider the inherent internal fire present in each substance.
